    Vinland Saga Season 2: Everything You Need to Know

    Kevin Follow Feb 17, 2023 · 4 mins read
    Share this

    Vinland Saga Season 2: Everything You Need to Know




    Vinland Saga, the popular anime series based on the manga of the same name, has been a hit with fans since its release in 2019. The first season was well received and left fans eagerly anticipating the release of the second season. In this article, we'll cover everything you need to know about Vinland Saga Season 2, from its release date and plot to the cast and crew. So, let's get started!

    Release Date

    First things first, when can we expect to see Vinland Saga Season 2? As of now, there is no official release date for the second season of the anime. However, in March 2021, it was announced that the series had been renewed for a second season, which means that the production is underway. Fans are hoping for a 2022 release, but there's no official word yet.


    Plot

    The first season of Vinland Saga followed the story of Thorfinn, a young warrior who seeks revenge against Askeladd, the man who killed his father. Along the way, he becomes involved in a larger conflict between the Danish and English armies, as well as the larger conflict between pagans and Christians.

    While there is no official plot synopsis for the second season, fans of the manga know what to expect. The second season will continue to follow the story of Thorfinn as he embarks on a new journey. Without giving away too much, the second season will see Thorfinn travel to Vinland, a legendary place that his father had once told him about. There, he will encounter new challenges and enemies, and his quest for revenge will take a backseat to new goals.


    Cast and Crew

    The first season of Vinland Saga was produced by Wit Studio, a well-known anime studio responsible for other popular series such as Attack on Titan and The Ancient Magus' Bride. The director of the first season was Shuhei Yabuta, while the script was written by Hiroshi Seko.

    As for the cast, the original Japanese voice actors are expected to reprise their roles for the second season. This includes Shizuka Ishigami as Thorfinn, Naoya Uchida as Askeladd, and Yuuto Uemura as Canute.


    Source Material

    As mentioned earlier, Vinland Saga is based on a manga of the same name by Makoto Yukimura. The manga was first published in 2005 and is still ongoing, with over 24 volumes currently available.

    The anime adaptation has been well received by fans of the manga, with many praising the series for its faithfulness to the source material. With the second season, fans can likely expect more of the same.


    Reception

    The first season of Vinland Saga was a critical and commercial success. It was praised for its animation, story, and characters, and many fans were left wanting more after the season's 24-episode run. On review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, the first season of Vinland Saga has a 100% approval rating based on 16 reviews, with an average rating of 9.1/10. The show's critical consensus reads, "Smart, violent, and surprisingly funny, Vinland Saga's second season expands its engrossing story while staying true to its roots."

    In addition to critical acclaim, the series has also been well-received by fans. Vinland Saga has a rating of 8.8/10 on MyAnimeList, a popular anime database and community website. Fans praise the series for its mature themes, complex characters, and action-packed story.


    Marketing and Promotion

    As of now, there hasn't been much in the way of marketing or promotion for Vinland Saga Season 2. However, fans can expect to see trailers and teasers as the release date approaches. The official Twitter account for the series (@V_SAGA_ANIME) is a good source for news and updates about the series. fans were left wanting more after the season's 24-episode run.     In addition to critical acclaim, the series has also been well-received by fans. Vinland Saga has a rating of 8.8/10 on MyAnimeList, a popular anime database and community website. Fans praise the series for its mature themes, complex characters, and action-packed story.


    Marketing and Promotion

    As of now, there hasn't been much in the way of marketing or promotion for Vinland Saga Season 2. However, fans can expect to see trailers and teasers as the release date approaches. The official Twitter account for the series (@V_SAGA_ANIME) is a good source for news and updates about the series.
